column4: hey guys, does installer resize NTFS partition if I don't have available space?
you want to install Ubuntu?  a dual boot with Windows?

yeah Windows only at the moment.  and so one big NTFS partition?
are you on the Live CD?
the installer can re size your Windows NTFS partition,  however  it's easier to do it your self . well at least on the graphical Live CD with Gparted anyway
mmmm, okey, I will need ntfstools anyway
what I tend to do if installing Ubuntu psyically is do my partitions with  gnome partition editor myself  and then yeah you tell the installer to install in the partition you just made

resizing partitions  using the Live CD  be that gparted or the installer  has  not done damage to Windows for me all those times, but there is a slight chance something could go wrong, so if you got any important data in Windows you should probably back that up first just to be sure
